title: GotaGoGama on for 33rd Day demanding President’s resignation
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Occupy Galle Face protest is taking place for the 33rd day today (11).
The peaceful protestors are demanding the immediate resignation of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa.
After the violent scene took place on Monday (9) at GotaGoGama and MynaGoGama, Mahinda Rajapaksa handed over his resignation to the President.
An extraordinary gazette was published late Monday (9) night confirming the resignation of Mahinda Rajapaksa, from the post of Prime Minister.

A normal Monday (9) morning turned into a scene of chaos after pro-government supporters attacked the MynaGoGama protest site near Temple Trees following a meeting chaired by then-Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa, where he announced he is willing to make any sacrifice for the people.
The meeting at Temple Trees was organized by the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna Local Government Members Forum and saw hundreds in attendance.
Following this meeting, the pro-government supporters attacked the MynaGoGama protest site near Temple Trees and dismantled the camp.
Thereafter, they moved to the main protest site in Galle Face known as GotaGoGama and destroyed several tents, and assaulted peaceful protestors.

Sri Lanka Police, the Riot Police, Sri Lanka Army, and other law enforcement agencies were called in to control the situation and Sri Lanka Police eventually imposed an island-wide curfew to control the unrest.
